page.title: 02Social Concerns
page.content: Because of a well documented history going back to the middle ages this area has maintained a very protective pride. While realizing that tourism is their livelihood tourists and 'off comers' are quietly resented and a 'locals only' housing policy was put forward but turned down by the Dept. of the Environment. This caused strong feeling and is to be pursued. Much property is in the 'second home' category, pushing up the price and making it impossible for local people to buy. Large touring coaches are now allowed on narrow roads and are much resented. People would like smaller, more frequent buses for local use. The district has a long history of being Conservative. There is no unemployment despite national figures and no one lives on social security.
